channel.title: The Ruby Testing Podcast
channel.description: On the Ruby Testing Podcast we discuss how to get started with testing as well as how to write better, more effective tests.
channel.itunes:author: Jason Swett
channel.itunes:summary: On the Ruby Testing Podcast we discuss how to get started with testing as well as how to write better, more effective tests.
channel.itunes:subtitle: On the Ruby Testing Podcast we discuss how to get started with testing as well as how to write better, more effective tests..
channel.itunes:keywords: ruby testing, ruby on rails testing

item.title: 015 - Testing Q&A with Listener Andrew Mason
item.description: Listener and junior Rails developer Andrew Mason comes on the show to ask some questions about Rails testing. We discuss the difference between function/integration/unit tests, system tests vs. feature specs, some good testing books to read, and more.
item.content:encoded:
Listener and junior Rails developer Andrew Mason comes on the show to ask some questions about Rails testing. We discuss the difference between function/integration/unit tests, system tests vs. feature specs, some good testing books to read, and more.

Links:

  • Onshore Studios
  • Andrew Mason on Twitter
  • Jason's Rails testing workshops
  • Software Testing Anti-Patterns
  • VCR
  • Continuous Delivery
  • System Tests
  • Growing Object-Oriented Software, Guided by Tests
  • Practical Object-Oriented Design, An Agile Primer Using Ruby
  • Working Effectively with Legacy Code
  • Everyday Rails Testing with RSpec
  • Rails 5 Test Prescriptions
  • xUnit Test Patterns: Refactoring Test Code
  • Minitest Cookbook
  • The Phoenix Project
item.author: jason@codewithjason.com (Jason Swett)
item.itunes:author: Jason Swett
item.itunes:summary: Listener and junior Rails developer Andrew Mason comes on the show to ask some questions about Rails testing. We discuss the difference between function/integration/unit tests, system tests vs. feature specs, some good testing books to read, and more.
item.itunes:subtitle: Listener and junior Rails developer Andrew Mason comes on the show to ask some questions about Rails testing. We discuss the difference between function/integration/unit tests, system tests vs. feature specs, some good testing books to read, and more.

item.title: 014 - Chris Oliver, Creator of GoRails
item.description: Me and Chris touched on about a billion topics in this episode including integration tests vs. unit tests, DRY in testing, dependency injection, Cucumber, and security.
item.content:encoded:
Me and Chris touched on about a billion topics in this episode including integration tests vs. unit tests, DRY in testing, dependency injection, Cucumber, and security.

Links:

  • GoRails
  • HatchBox
  • Remote Ruby Podcast
item.author: jason@codewithjason.com (Jason Swett)
item.itunes:author: Jason Swett
item.itunes:summary: Me and Chris touched on about a billion topics in this episode including integration tests vs. unit tests, DRY in testing, dependency injection, Cucumber, and security.
item.itunes:subtitle: Me and Chris touched on about a billion topics in this episode including integration tests vs. unit tests, DRY in testing, dependency injection, Cucumber, and security.

item.title: 013 - The Balance Between Testing and Feature Development with Dave Kimura
item.description: Building features and writing tests are often seen as competing with one another. How do you balance the two? Dave Kimura and I discuss.
item.content:encoded:
Building features and writing tests are often seen as competing with one another. How do you balance the two? Dave Kimura and I discuss.

Links:

  • Dave Kimura on Twitter
  • Drifting Ruby
item.author: jason@codewithjason.com (Jason Swett)
item.itunes:author: Jason Swett
item.itunes:summary: Building features and writing tests are often seen as competing with one another. How do you balance the two? Dave Kimura and I discuss.
item.itunes:subtitle: Building features and writing tests are often seen as competing with one another. How do you balance the two? Dave Kimura and I discuss.

item.title: 012 - Refactoring Legacy Projects and Test Suites with John Cech
item.description: I talk with John Cech of Planet Argon about refactoring legacy Rails projects and legacy test suites.
item.content:encoded:
I talk with John Cech of Planet Argon about refactoring legacy Rails projects and legacy test suites.

Links:

  • Planet Argon
  • Working Effectively with Legacy Code

item.title: 011 - How Jason Charnes Got Started with Testing
item.description: In this episode I talk with Jason Charnes, organizer of the Southeast Ruby conference and co-host of the Remote Ruby podcast, about how he got started with testing.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode I talk with Jason Charnes, organizer of the Southeast Ruby conference and co-host of the Remote Ruby podcast, about how he got started with testing.

item.title: 010 - Selenium and QA with Zach Attas
item.description: In this episode I talk with Zach Attas, Senior Test Engineer, about QA, Selenium, SitePrism and a number of other things.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode I talk with Zach Attas, Senior Test Engineer, about QA, Selenium, SitePrism and a number of other things.

  • Udacity course on software testing
  • Zach's personal website
  • SeleniumConf India 2018 talk
  • Selenium

item.title: 009 - Testing a Ruby Gem with Josh Wood of Honeybadger
item.description: In this episode I talk with Josh about the process of building the honeybadger-ruby gem and what was involved in testing it.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode I talk with Josh about the process of building the honeybadger-ruby gem and what was involved in testing it.

item.title: 008 - Adam Hawkins - Where, What and How to Test
item.description: Me and Adam Hawkins talk about where, what and how to test. Adam brought up some interesting ideas I hadn't thought about before including not only testing your code but testing your deployment pipeline.
item.content:encoded:
Me and Adam Hawkins talk about where, what and how to test. Adam brought up some interesting ideas I hadn't thought about before including not only testing your code but testing your deployment pipeline.

Links:

  • Adam's blog
  • Adam's website
  • Rediscovering the joy of design
  • Developing with Rake & Docker
  • TeamCI
item.author: jason@codewithjason.com (Jason Swett)
item.itunes:author: Jason Swett
item.itunes:summary: Me and Adam Hawkins talk about where, what and how to test. Adam brought up some interesting ideas I hadn't thought about before including not only testing your code but testing your deployment pipeline.

item.title: 007 - Testing Anti-Patterns with Kostis Kapelonis
item.description: Kostis Kapelonis and I talk about some of the testing anti-patterns he discusses in his comprehensive article, Software Testing Anti-patterns.
item.content:encoded:
Kostis Kapelonis and I talk about some of the testing anti-patterns he discusses in his comprehensive article, Software Testing Anti-patterns.

item.title: 006 - Continuous Integration/Deployment/Delivery with Marko Anastasov
item.description: I talk with Semaphore CI Co-Founder Marko Anastasov about how he got started with programming and testing. We also talk about Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Delivery and the difference among the three.
item.content:encoded:
I talk with Semaphore CI Co-Founder Marko Anastasov about how he got started with programming and testing. We also talk about Continuous Integration, Continuous Deployment, Continuous Delivery and the difference among the three.

Links:

  • Marko on Twitter
  • Semaphore CI
  • Continuous Delivery book

item.title: 005 - How Brittany Martin Got Started with Programming and Testing
item.description: In this episode I talk with Brittany Martin, co-host of the Ruby on Rails Podcast, about her career story and how she got started with Ruby testing.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode I talk with Brittany Martin, co-host of the Ruby on Rails Podcast, about Brittany's career story and how she got started with Ruby testing. We also talked about remote work and speaking at conference. Things we touched on:

  • Ruby on Rails Podcast
  • Pittsburg Cultural Trust
  • Southeast Ruby conference
  • RubyConf MY conference
  • Brittany on Twitter

item.title: 004 - Test-Driven Design with Yoseph Radding
item.description: In this episode Yoseph and I talk about test-driven design.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode Yoseph and I talk about test-driven design. Things we touched on:

  • Yoseph's blog post, From Test Driven Development to Test Driven Design
  • Yoseph's website
  • SOLID principles
  • Design Patterns: Elements of Reusable Object-Oriented Software
  • Patterns of Enterprise Application Architecture
  • Martin Fowler
item.author: jason@codewithjason.com (Jason Swett)

item.itunes:summary: In this episode Yoseph and I talk about test-driven design.

item.title: 003 - Aaron Sumner, Author of Everyday Rails Testing with RSpec
item.description: In this episode I interview Aaron Sumner, author of Everyday Rails Testing with RSpec.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode I interview Aaron Sumner, author of Everyday Rails Testing with RSpec.

Things we touched on:

  • Everyday Rails Testing with RSpec

  • Rails 5 Test Prescriptions
  • Rails Application Templates

item.title: 002 - Noel Rappin, Author of Rails 5 Test Prescriptions
item.description: In this episode I talk with Noel Rappin, author of Rails 5 Test Prescriptions, about how Noel got started in testing in the early 2000s, how Noel approaches unit tests vs. integration tests, testing JavaScript code in a Rails environment, as well as a number of other topics.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode I talk with Noel Rappin, author of Rails 5 Test Prescriptions, about how Noel got started in testing in the early 2000s, how Noel approaches unit tests vs. integration tests, testing JavaScript code in a Rails environment, as well as a number of other topics.

Links:

  • Noel Rappin's website
  • Rails 5 Test Prescriptions
  • Tech Done Right
  • Test Double
  • Growing Object-Oriented Software, Guided by Tests
  • Extreme Programming Explained
item.author: jason@codewithjason.com (Jason Swett)

item.title: 001 - How Todd Siegel Got Started with Testing
item.description: In this episode I talk with Todd Siegel, freelance developer from Denver, about how Todd got started in testing, how testing saves development time, how we approach writing tests for a fresh Rails project, and RSpec vs. other testing frameworks.
item.content:encoded:
In this episode I talk with Todd Siegel, freelance developer from Denver, about how Todd got started in testing, how testing saves development time, how we approach writing tests for a fresh Rails project, and RSpec vs. other testing frameworks.

Links:

  • Todd Siegel on Twitter
